WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Some code navigation using the Eclipse plugin has been getting worse going from 0.9.1.1 to 0.9.5. I've already logged this with the plugin owner (https://github.com/palantir/eclipse-typescript/issues/113), but he thinks this is probably a regression with the Ts language service.

1.
import Menu = require('src/components/menu/Menu');

With 0.9.1.1 I can control/cmd click on the require file path and it takes me to the file.
With 0.9.5 it does nothing.

2.
this.menu = new Menu()

With 0.9.1.1 I can control/cmd click on the class and it takes me to the class definition.
With 0.9.5 it takes me to the import statement.
WorkItem.Summary: Go To Definition on import/require statements

Comments.Message: Did the definition info that comes back from the language service change in 0.9.5? Perhaps I just need to adjust how that info is interpreted by the eclipse plug-in...

It appears that this sorta worked in earlier versions but not in a particularly intentional way and now is broken entirely. It's definitely something we'd like to have robust support for in the future but isn't going to happen for 1.0. Marking as a suggestion.
